edu.lehigh.cse.lol

Class HelpLevel

  • java.lang.Object
    • ScreenAdapter
      • edu.lehigh.cse.lol.HelpLevel

  • public class HelpLevel
extends ScreenAdapter
    HelpLevel provides an interface for drawing to the help screens of a game

    • Method Summary

      Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      static void configure(int red, int green, int blue)
      Configure a help level by setting its background color
      static void drawPicture(int x, int y, int width, int height, java.lang.String imgName)
      Draw a picture on the current help scene Note: the order in which this is called relative to other entities will determine whether they go under or over this picture.
      static void drawText(int x, int y, java.lang.String message)
      Print a message on the current help scene.

      Print a message on the current help scene.
      void render(float delta)
      The main render loop for Help Levels.

    • Method Detail

      • render

        public void render(float delta)
        The main render loop for Help Levels. There's nothing fancy here
        Parameters:
        delta - The time that has transpired since the last render

      • configure

        public static void configure(int red,
             int green,
             int blue)
        Configure a help level by setting its background color
        Parameters:
        red - The red component of the background color (0-255)
        green - The green component of the background color (0-255)
        blue - The blue component of the background color (0-255)

      • drawPicture

        public static void drawPicture(int x,
               int y,
               int width,
               int height,
               java.lang.String imgName)
        Draw a picture on the current help scene Note: the order in which this is called relative to other entities will determine whether they go under or over this picture.
        Parameters:
        x - X coordinate of bottom left corner
        y - Y coordinate of bottom left corner
        width - Width of the picture
        height - Height of this picture
        imgName - Name of the picture to display

      • drawText

        public static void drawText(int x,
            int y,
            java.lang.String message)
        Print a message on the current help scene. This version of the addText method uses the default font.
        Parameters:
        x - X coordinate of text
        y - Y coordinate of text
        message - The message to display

      • drawText

        public static void drawText(int x,
            int y,
            java.lang.String message,
            int red,
            int green,
            int blue,
            java.lang.String fontName,
            int size)
        Print a message on the current help scene. This version of the addText method allows the programmer to specify the appearance of the font
        Parameters:
        x - The X coordinate of the bottom left corner (in pixels)
        y - The Y coordinate of the bottom left corner (in pixels)
        message - The message to display
        red - The red portion of text color (0-255)
        green - The green portion of text color (0-255)
        blue - The blue portion of text color (0-255)
        fontname - The name of the font file to use
        size - The font size to use (20 is usually a good value)
